import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.3372d649:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.5b9a6641:
plt.figure(figsize=(15, 12))
plt.subplot(421)
sns.countplot(x='Gender', hue='PlacedOrNot', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Gender vs Placement')
plt.subplot(422)
sns.countplot(y='Stream', hue='PlacedOrNot', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Stream vs Placement')
plt.subplot(423)
sns.countplot(x='Age', hue='PlacedOrNot', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Age vs Placement')
plt.subplot(424)
sns.countplot(x='PlacedOrNot', hue='Internships', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Internship vs Placement')
plt.subplot(425)
sns.countplot(x='PlacedOrNot', hue='CGPA', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('CGPA vs Placement')
plt.subplot(426)
sns.countplot(x='PlacedOrNot', hue='Hostel', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Hostel vs Placement')
plt.subplot(427)
sns.countplot(x='PlacedOrNot', hue='HistoryOfBacklogs', data=df)
plt.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1),borderaxespad=0)
plt.title('Histry of Backlogs vs Placement')
plt.subplots_adjust(hspace=0.5)
plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=1)

source.b775ae1c: 3) Visualization of Placemant and other features
source.05467bca: * The ratios of female in Computer Science, Electronics and Communication, Information Technology are higher than Mechanical, Electrical and Civil.
source.d4bbaf40:
* Female seem to be more successful in placement than male. So I will look into the detail in next step.
* I can find the difference of palcement in streams. In Computer Science, Electronics and Communication, Information Technology and Electrical, placement  outnumber no-placement.
* Age 21,24,25 add 26 get good result in placement. 
* Many people who had replacement have also internship experience. It means that if we can get good experience which is useful in bisiness via internship, it will be nice.
* All people in CGPA 8 and 9 got placement. It means that studing hard and getting good score in CGPA will ensure us the placement.
source.13ea64e9: Female seem to be more successful in placement than male. So I look into the detail of difference between male and femail.
source.9682e566:
* PlaceOrNot and CGPA have strong correlationship 0.59.
* PlaceOrNot and Internship have weak correlationship 0.18.
* PlaceOrNot and Age, Stream of Computer Science, Electronics and Communication,and Information Technology have a little bit correlationship.
* As for PlaceOrNot and Gender, Male has a little bit negative and Female has a little bit positive.
* Gender Female and Hostel have strong correlationship 0.58.

source.f048f9ef:
# 1. Insight
* The score of CGPA is very important for the placement. The score 8 or 9 will ensure you the placement.
* We should study Computer Science, Electronics and Communication,or Information Technology, if we want to take in advantage in placement.
* Internship is also important in the case we can experience the business.
* If we are over 23 years old in university formsome reason, we can still find job opportunities if we have good score in CGPA.
